item.title: By the bus stop and barrier to the footpath, 27th January
item.description:
This is another terrible gash along Swindon Lane. The whole surface should be stripped and relaid rather than keep coming out - often to redo when a reparied hole comes out again. This one is By the bus stop and barrier to the footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Swindon Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham

item.title: A long gash outside No 48 Swindon Lane, 27th January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 27th January
item.description:
Tree has lost its limb this morning, it has been moved to the RBT. The cllr would like this inspected and they are concerned and the tree is of significant pride to the area and they do not want to lose it. They mention a TBC tree officer has looked at this and noted some concerns previously.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect Road Markings, 27th January
item.description:
The A346 southbound from the intersection with Hyde Lane. The two lanes for southbound traffic are wrongly marked. The right of the two lanes is the 'through lane', the left lane is for merging only with the right lane as the left lane quickly ends. The signage on the road, however, suggests that the traffic in the right lane should merge left. This is effectively merging traffic from a straight lane into a lane that soon disappears. This is dangerous and a complete change from the historically safe lane conditions that were in force before the recent works on the cycle path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Road marking white lines or studs

item.title: Unauthorised cones being used, 27th January
item.description:
These cones are being used for save spaces for the visitors of number 13 there are no double yellow lines on the floor and they also have a drive way for 2/3 vehicles that they donny use when visitors come they park there van on the corner on the junction making it hard for people to get through and still have the cones out which in my eyes you cannot use your own cones on a public highway to do so.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aspen Way, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen very large tree, 27th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
